de.esoco.process

Class ProcessRunner

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.obrel.core.RelatedObject
      • de.esoco.process.ProcessRunner
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    de.esoco.lib.manage.RunCheck, de.esoco.lib.manage.Stoppable, java.lang.Runnable, org.obrel.core.Relatable

    public class ProcessRunner
extends org.obrel.core.RelatedObject
implements java.lang.Runnable, de.esoco.lib.manage.RunCheck, de.esoco.lib.manage.Stoppable
    An class that executes a certain Process. It implements the Runnable interface so that it a process can be executed in a separate thread.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
      protected ProcessRunner()
      Creates a new instance.
        ProcessRunner(ProcessDefinition rProcessDefinition)
      Creates a new instance for a certain process definition.

      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Internal method that is called right after the process execution has finished The default implementation does nothing.

      Internal method that is called right before the process execution starts.
      void executeOnce()
      Run the process now even if it is currently paused or not scheduled to run in the future.

      Run the process now even if it is currently paused or not scheduled to run in the future.

      This is called when the execution of a process fails and throws an Exception.
      boolean isRunning()
      TRUE if the ProcessRunner is running.
      void resume()
      Resumes the execution of this runner if it is currently waiting.

      Resumes the execution of this runner if it is currently pausing.
      void run()
      Executes the process this runner is associated with.

      Sets the logLevel.

      Sets the logOnError.
      protected void setProcessDefinition(ProcessDefinition rProcessDefinition)
      Sets the process definition to be used for the instantiation of the executed processes.
      void setProcessScheduler(ProcessScheduler rProcessScheduler)
      Sets an optional process scheduler instance that provides the scheduling context of this instance.
      void stop()
      Stops this runner and the associated process.

      • getProcess

        public final Process getProcess()
        Returns the current process of this instance. Will be NULL if is has not yet been initialized.
        Returns:
        The current process (NULL for none)

      • getProcessDefinition

        public ProcessDefinition getProcessDefinition()
        Checks whether this ProcessRunner runs an instance of the ProcessDefinition given as the parameter.
        Returns:
        TRUE it the given parameter is the class this ProcessRunner is running an instance of, FALSE otherwise.

      • afterExecution

        protected void afterExecution(Process rProcess)
                       throws java.lang.Exception
        Internal method that is called right after the process execution has finished The default implementation does nothing.
        Parameters:
        rProcess - the schedule process that was executed.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - subclasses may throw any kind of exception

      • beforeExecution

        protected void beforeExecution(Process rProcess)
                        throws java.lang.Exception
        Internal method that is called right before the process execution starts. The default implementation does nothing.
        Parameters:
        rProcess - the schedule process that will be executed.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - subclasses may throw any kind of exception

      • getNextScheduleTime

        protected java.util.Date getNextScheduleTime()
                                      throws java.lang.Exception
        Returns the date and time of the next schedule at which the process needs to be executed. Subclasses may override this method to perform a schedule calculation or read the the schedule from a database record.

        The default implementation sets the schedule time to the time at the creation of this instance so that the process would executed only once.

        Returns:
        The schedule timestamp
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If determining the schedule date fails

      • getProcessUser

        protected Entity getProcessUser()
        Returns the entity that describes the user that is responsible for the process execution. This will be set into the process as the parameter #
        Returns:
        The user used for the executed process (can be NULL)

      • handleProcessExecutionException

        protected void handleProcessExecutionException(java.lang.Exception e)
        This is called when the execution of a process fails and throws an Exception. Implementing subclasses should take appropriate action.
        Parameters:
        e - rE The Exception that occurred.

        Sets the continueOnError.
        Parameters:
        bContinueOnError - The continueOnError value
